boat.construction_details: Clinker, larch on sawn oak frames. Copper fastened, lead keel. Douglas fir spars.

for_sales.sales_text:
Kamala - a relatively young and delightful Gaffer with a difference!

Built in Denmark 1986 of Scandinavian Larch on heavy Oak framing. Colin Archer Pilot boat style. High quality build with Lead ballast. About 2 tons total. She’s 21ft-6ins on deck, 7 ft bowsprit; 3 ft draft with generous beam of 8ft-6ins giving a wonderfully clear and easy to work fore’deck with space below for 2 berths. See C.B. Sept 1989.

People who have sailed remark on her feel of a larger boat; she’s steady, well balanced, picks up her skirt in a freshening breeze and her shoulders give great stability in a heavier wind. Her lower freeboard amidships is really convenient but thanks to her raised bow she keeps remarkably dry.

Mariner outboard,  anchors, overall covers, flares, tender and outboard and lots more “stuff” !   Retirement sale inviting offers around £4,150.  Optional 4 wheel road trailer £1500.   Lying Hamble.    contact  martinbandey@aol.com 07768 074796

boat.full_description:
Orginally a 3/4 deck dayboat, Kamala later had a small cabin top added by the original builder prior to coming to England  in the late 1990s, Purchased in   2016 from her second owner, when laid up in a Hampshire farmyard.

People who have sailed remark on her feel of a larger boat; she’s steady, well balanced, picks up her skirt in a freshening breeze and her shoulders give great stability in a heavier wind. Her lower freeboard amidships is really convenient but thanks to her raised bow she keeps remarkably dry.
